intro: Anthriscus sylvestris var. abyssinica, commonly known as Ethiopian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in its native habitat.
